wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the project overview section focused on the React Native sports match listing application. Explain the app's purpose as a mobile sports scheduling platform, its core value proposition, and target audience. Document the key features including match listings with countdown timers, infinite scrolling, tournament filtering, and real-time updates. Describe the application's role in the sports entertainment ecosystem and how it enhances user engagement with live sports content. Include both conceptual overviews for stakeholders and technical highlights for developers. Use terminology consistent with the sports and mobile development domains. Provide practical examples demonstrating common use cases and user workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: HTTP Client Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the HTTP client configuration using Axios. Document the base URL setup, timeout configuration, and header settings. Explain the request interceptor implementation for adding authentication tokens and handling pre-flight requests. Detail the response interceptor for centralized error handling, status code processing, and error message extraction. Include examples of successful request handling and error scenarios. Document the Axios instance creation pattern, configuration options, and best practices for API communication. Address debugging techniques and logging strategies for API requests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Common Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for common UI components used throughout the sports match application. Detail the implementation of EmptyState component for displaying empty results scenarios, ErrorState component for error messaging and recovery actions, and LoadingSpinner component for indicating asynchronous operations. Explain the props interface for each component, including customization options for colors, messages, and layout. Document the component composition patterns, accessibility features, and integration with the overall design system. Include usage examples showing how these components are utilized across different screens and contexts. Address performance considerations for loading states and error handling patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Display System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the match display system. Detail the MatchList component implementation with infinite scroll pagination, FlatList optimization techniques, and loading state management. Explain the MatchCard component structure showing match information display, team logos, and match status indicators. Document the skeleton loading system for improved user experience during data fetch operations. Cover empty state and error state handling with appropriate user feedback mechanisms. Include pull-to-refresh functionality, pagination thresholds, and performance optimization strategies like windowSize and maxToRenderPerBatch configurations. Provide examples of component composition patterns and state management integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Constants and Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the constants and configuration utilities. Explain the API base URLs, media base URLs, default timezone settings, and page size configurations. Document the color palette system including primary colors, semantic colors (live, upcoming, completed), and theme-related color definitions. Detail the sport-specific configurations including sport colors mapping for different sports (Cricket, Soccer, Australian Rules, Basketball, Rugby League) and sport icons mapping. Include usage examples showing how these constants are imported and used throughout the application, configuration best practices, and how to extend or modify the configuration system for new sports or themes.

wiki_catalogs.name: CountdownTimer Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the CountdownTimer component implementation. Explain the component's props interface including targetDate, timezone, and matchStatus parameters. Document the conditional rendering logic for LIVE status with animated pulse effect, expired matches showing 'Started' text, and countdown display with formatted time remaining. Cover the component's memo optimization, styling with Tailwind classes, and integration with the useCountdown hook. Include examples of component usage in match cards, prop validation requirements, and responsive design considerations for different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match List Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the MatchList component implementation. Explain the FlatList configuration with windowSize, maxToRenderPerBatch, and initialNumToRender optimizations for smooth scrolling performance. Document the infinite scroll pagination mechanism using React Query's getNextPageParam and fetchNextPage functions. Detail the pull-to-refresh functionality with refetch operations and loading state management. Cover the intersection observer implementation for triggering next page loads. Include examples of component props, error handling strategies, and integration with the useMatches hook. Address performance considerations like item layout measurement and virtualization benefits.

wiki_catalogs.name: Filter Context Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the FilterContext provider implementation. Explain the FilterState interface with selectedTournamentIds array and pendingTournamentIds for temporary selections. Document the FilterContextType interface including all context methods: toggleTournament for individual selection toggling, selectTournaments for bulk selection, clearFilters for resetting state, applyFilters for committing changes, and isFilterActive for checking filter status. Cover the dual-state management approach using both filters and pendingTournamentIds for immediate UI feedback vs. persisted state. Include the provider component structure, context value object creation, and error handling for useFilter hook usage. Provide examples of context consumption in components and state synchronization patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Filter Context
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the FilterContext implementation. Detail the FilterState interface with selectedTournamentIds property and FilterContextType with all context methods. Explain the provider pattern implementation including state initialization, pending state management, and filter lifecycle. Document each method: toggleTournament for individual selection, selectTournaments for bulk operations, clearFilters for reset functionality, and applyFilters for committing changes. Cover the dual-state architecture with filters (committed) and pendingTournamentIds (draft). Include practical examples of context usage in components, error handling for missing provider, and integration patterns with the bottom sheet filter UI.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for the React Native sports match application. Include detailed prerequisites covering Node.js versions, npm/yarn requirements, Expo CLI installation, and platform-specific development environments (iOS Simulator/macOS or Android Emulator). Provide step-by-step installation instructions starting from repository cloning through dependency installation to development server startup. Document platform-specific running instructions including iOS simulator (press 'i'), Android emulator (press 'a'), and physical device setup via QR code scanning. Include troubleshooting tips for common setup issues, environment verification steps, and initial project structure exploration. Make content accessible to developers new to React Native while ensuring experienced developers can quickly get up and running.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Data Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the match data service implementation. Detail the match list retrieval API endpoint, including pagination parameters (limit/offset), filtering options (timezone, status, tournament_ids), and sorting capabilities. Document the data transformation patterns from API responses to application models. Explain the infinite scroll implementation using React Query's infinite query pattern. Include request/response schemas, parameter validation, and error handling strategies. Provide examples of API usage patterns, caching mechanisms, and performance optimization techniques. Address timezone handling, status filtering, and real-time data updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for match-specific UI components that handle sports match display and interaction. Document the MatchCard component implementation including team information display, match status indicators, and interactive elements. Explain the MatchList component's infinite scroll implementation, pagination handling, and performance optimizations. Detail the CountdownTimer component's real-time update mechanism, time calculation logic, and status-based rendering. Cover the MatchSkeleton component for skeleton loading states during data fetching. Include component prop interfaces, event handling patterns, and integration with the data fetching hooks. Address responsive design considerations and accessibility compliance for sports match displays.

wiki_catalogs.name: Countdown Timer System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the countdown timer system that tracks live match times. Explain the CountdownTimer component implementation with real-time updates, time formatting, and status-based display logic. Document the useCountdown hook pattern for managing timer state, interval handling, and cleanup operations. Cover date utility functions for timezone handling, time calculations, and match status determination. Include examples of timer lifecycle management, performance considerations for frequent updates, and integration with match data fetching. Address edge cases like timezone differences, daylight saving changes, and timer synchronization across component re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Date and Time Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the date and time utility functions. Detail the timezone handling mechanisms, date parsing and formatting functions, and match timing calculations. Explain the implementation of date difference calculations for countdown timers, timezone conversion utilities, and locale-specific date formatting. Document function signatures, parameter requirements, return value formats, and error handling patterns. Include practical examples of date comparisons, time remaining calculations, and integration with the countdown timer components. Address edge cases like daylight saving time changes, international users, and performance considerations for frequent date operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: useCountdown Hook
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the useCountdown hook pattern. Explain the hook's implementation for managing timer state, calculating time differences, and handling interval updates. Document the hook's parameters including targetDate and timezone, return values with display formatting and expiration detection. Cover interval management, cleanup operations, and memory leak prevention. Include examples of hook usage in components, performance optimization techniques for frequent updates, and handling edge cases like timezone changes and daylight saving transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Card Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the MatchCard component structure and implementation. Explain the card layout design showing team information, logos, match status, and countdown timer integration. Document the component's prop interface including match data structure, team information display, and status indicators. Detail the responsive design patterns for different screen sizes and orientation changes. Cover the integration with CountdownTimer component for live match tracking. Include examples of team logo loading with fallback mechanisms, match status display logic, and click handlers for match details navigation. Address accessibility considerations and touch target sizing for mobile interfaces.

wiki_catalogs.name: Filter Sheet Modal
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the FilterSheet component implementation. Detail the bottom sheet modal behavior using @gorhom/bottom-sheet library with gesture handling, animation configurations, and backdrop interactions. Document the component's role in displaying tournament categories and managing user interactions for filter selection. Cover the integration with FilterContext for accessing filter state and applying user selections. Include modal positioning, sizing considerations, and responsive design adaptations. Address user experience patterns like swipe-to-dismiss, overlay tapping, and keyboard handling. Provide examples of modal lifecycle management and integration with parent components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Use Matches Hook
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the useMatches hook implementing React Query's infinite query pattern. Explain the hook's role in fetching paginated match data with automatic caching and pagination handling. Document the query key structure, parameter handling, and cursor-based pagination implementation. Cover data transformation, error handling strategies, and loading state management. Include examples of hook usage in components, cache invalidation patterns, and integration with the match list UI. Address performance optimizations like query deduplication, background refetching, and memory management for large match datasets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the React Native sports match application. Describe the high-level design patterns including component-based architecture, provider pattern for state management, and hook-based data fetching. Document the application's layered architecture with presentation layer (components), business logic layer (hooks), data access layer (services), and state management layer (context + React Query). Explain the routing architecture using Expo Router's file-based navigation system. Detail component relationships, data flow patterns, and integration points between major subsystems. Include system boundaries, cross-cutting concerns like performance optimization and error handling, and the rationale behind architectural decisions. Provide architectural diagrams showing component hierarchy and data flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tournament Data Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the tournament data service responsible for metadata retrieval and sport categorization. Document the tournament list API endpoint, including sport-based filtering and tournament selection mechanisms. Explain the data structure for tournament entities, sport associations, and category organization. Detail the multi-select filtering implementation and integration with the bottom sheet modal. Include examples of tournament data fetching, caching strategies, and performance considerations. Document the relationship between tournaments and matches, sport categorization logic, and filter persistence mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Filter Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for filter-related UI components that enable tournament-based filtering functionality. Detail the FilterSheet component implementation including bottom sheet modal behavior, gesture handling, and multi-select tournament selection. Explain the SportSection component's organization of tournaments by sport categories, expandable sections, and selection state management. Document the component integration with the FilterContext for state management and the bottom sheet's interaction with the main match list. Include implementation details for the modal presentation, dismissal handling, and filter application workflow. Address user experience considerations for touch interactions and accessibility features for screen readers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Filtering System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the tournament filtering system with multi-select capabilities. Explain the FilterContext provider implementation for state management, filter persistence, and context propagation throughout the component tree. Document the FilterSheet component with bottom sheet modal behavior, gesture handling, and animation configurations. Cover the SportSection component for organizing tournaments by sport categories and managing multi-select interactions. Include filter state synchronization, apply/cancel functionality, and integration with match data fetching. Address user experience considerations like filter persistence across sessions, clear filters functionality, and responsive design for different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Formatting Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the formatting utility functions. Explain the score formatting functions, time display formatting, and match data presentation utilities. Document the implementation of human-readable time formats, score string transformations, and data normalization functions. Include examples of how formatted data is used in the UI components, parameter specifications for each formatter function, and return value formats. Address localization considerations, accessibility formatting for screen readers, and performance optimization for frequently called formatting functions. Provide guidelines for extending the formatting system with new data types or locales.

wiki_catalogs.name: Date Utilities and Timezone Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for date utility functions used in the countdown system. Document timezone handling functions, time calculation algorithms, and match status determination logic. Explain the isMatchLive function implementation, date parsing and formatting utilities, and timezone conversion methods. Cover performance considerations for date operations, handling of edge cases like leap years and month boundaries, and integration with internationalization requirements. Include examples of timezone handling across different regions and daylight saving time scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Loading Skeleton System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the loading skeleton system implementation. Detail the MatchSkeleton component design showing animated placeholders for match cards with realistic loading patterns. Explain the skeleton animation techniques using NativeWind animations and opacity transitions. Document the LoadingSpinner component for full-screen loading states and its integration with the main MatchList component. Cover the skeleton-to-content transition patterns and timing considerations for optimal user experience. Include examples of skeleton layouts for different screen orientations and device sizes. Address performance implications of skeleton rendering and memory usage optimization strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sport Section Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the SportSection component responsible for organizing tournaments by sport categories. Explain the component's role in rendering sport-specific tournament lists, managing multi-select interactions within each sport category, and maintaining visual hierarchy. Document the data structure requirements for sport-tournament relationships, rendering optimization for large datasets, and user interaction patterns for selecting multiple tournaments. Cover the integration with FilterContext for state synchronization and the callback mechanism for updating selections. Include accessibility considerations, touch target sizing, and responsive layout adaptations. Provide examples of sport categorization logic and tournament selection handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: Use Tournaments Hook
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the useTournaments hook managing tournament metadata fetching and caching. Explain the hook's implementation for retrieving tournament data with automatic refetching and error handling. Document the query configuration, caching strategies, and data normalization patterns. Cover integration with the filter system, tournament selection UI, and sport categorization logic. Include examples of hook usage, loading state management, and error boundary implementation. Address performance considerations like query optimization, cache warming, and background updates for tournament data freshness.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive technology stack documentation for the React Native sports match application. Detail the core frameworks including React Native 0.81.5 with Expo 54.0.33, explaining the benefits and integration patterns. Document state management solutions including React Query for server state caching and Context API for local state. Explain styling approach using NativeWind/Tailwind CSS for React Native, configuration options, and responsive design patterns. Cover development tools including TypeScript for type safety, Babel for transpilation, Metro bundler for module resolution, and ESLint for code quality. Include version compatibility matrices, dependency relationships, and rationale for technology choices. Address platform-specific considerations for iOS and Android development.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the state management architecture combining React Context API and React Query. Explain the FilterContext implementation for tournament filtering state, including filter selection, persistence, and state updates. Detail the useMatches hook pattern for infinite query management, pagination handling, and data caching strategies. Cover the useTournaments hook for fetching and managing tournament metadata with automatic refetching and error handling. Include integration patterns between context state and query state, optimistic updates, and cache invalidation strategies. Address performance optimizations like query deduplication, background refetching, and memory management for large datasets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Haptics and Feedback
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the haptic feedback and user interaction utilities. Explain the implementation of haptic feedback patterns for different user actions, touch interaction responses, and system feedback mechanisms. Detail the integration with React Native's haptics API, vibration patterns for different scenarios (success, error, selection), and platform-specific considerations. Include usage examples showing how haptic feedback is triggered during user interactions like filter application, pull-to-refresh, and match selection. Address accessibility considerations for users with hearing impairments, customization options for haptic intensity, and performance implications of frequent haptic calls.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the state management components handling empty and error states. Explain the EmptyState component implementation showing appropriate messaging, call-to-action buttons, and visual design for zero-results scenarios. Document the ErrorState component with error message display, retry functionality, and user guidance patterns. Detail the integration with React Query error states and loading states from the useMatches hook. Cover the conditional rendering logic based on data availability and error conditions. Include examples of custom error messages, retry mechanisms, and navigation options for state transitions. Address accessibility considerations for state change announcements and keyboard navigation support.

wiki_catalogs.name: Project Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed project structure documentation for the React Native sports match application. Explain the directory organization with emphasis on the app/ structure containing components/, hooks/, services/, types/, utils/, context/, and the assets/ directory for static resources. Document file naming conventions, module separation strategy, and the rationale behind the organizational structure. Detail the purpose of each major directory including components for reusable UI elements, hooks for data fetching logic, services for API communication, types for TypeScript definitions, utils for shared utilities, and context for state management. Include the root layout configuration, main entry point, and how the file-based routing system works with Expo Router. Provide guidance on where to place new features and maintain consistency with existing patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the core features of the sports match application. Detail the main functional areas including match display system with infinite scroll and pagination, countdown timer system for live match tracking, tournament filtering with multi-select capabilities, and state management for filter persistence. Explain the integration between components, hooks, and services that enable these features. Document user workflows, feature interactions, and the technical implementation patterns used. Include performance considerations, optimization strategies, and error handling approaches. Address the relationship between different feature modules and how they work together to provide a cohesive user experience.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API integration documentation for the sports match application. Document the HTTP client configuration using Axios, request/response interceptors, and error handling mechanisms. Detail the match data service implementation including pagination parameters (limit/offset), filtering options (timezone, status, tournament_ids), and data transformation patterns. Explain the tournament data service for metadata retrieval and sport categorization. Include API endpoint specifications, request/response schemas, authentication methods, and rate limiting considerations. Document the media service integration for team logo loading with fallback mechanisms. Provide examples of API usage patterns, error handling strategies, and debugging approaches. Address caching strategies and offline behavior considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed component architecture documentation for the React Native sports match application. Explain the component hierarchy with common components for shared UI elements, match components for sports-specific displays, and filter components for tournament selection. Document component composition patterns, prop interfaces, and state management integration. Detail the implementation of reusable components like EmptyState, ErrorState, and LoadingSpinner, and specialized components like MatchCard, MatchList, and CountdownTimer. Include component lifecycle management, performance optimization techniques, and accessibility considerations. Explain the relationship between presentational and container components, and how components communicate through props, context, and event handlers. Address component testing strategies and reusability patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive state management documentation for the sports match application. Detail the dual-state management approach using React Context API for filter state and React Query for server state caching. Explain the FilterContext implementation for managing tournament selections, filter persistence, and state synchronization. Document the custom hooks useMatches and useTournaments for data fetching, caching, and pagination. Include state update patterns, subscription mechanisms, and performance optimization strategies. Detail the integration between local state (filters) and remote state (match data), including cache invalidation and refetching strategies. Address state persistence across app sessions, error handling in state operations, and debugging approaches for state-related issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling and Theming
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed styling and theming documentation for the React Native sports match application. Explain the NativeWind/Tailwind CSS integration for React Native, including configuration options, utility class usage, and responsive design patterns. Document the color scheme, typography system, spacing conventions, and design token organization. Detail the implementation of dark/light mode support, platform-specific styling considerations, and accessibility-friendly design patterns. Include component styling approaches, animation systems, and interactive state styling. Address performance optimization for styling, CSS-in-JS alternatives, and maintaining design consistency across components. Provide guidelines for extending the design system and adding new styling patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Utilities and Helpers
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive utilities and helpers documentation for the React Native sports match application. Detail the utility functions including date and time handling with timezone support, formatting functions for match data presentation, constant definitions for configuration values, and haptic feedback integration. Explain the implementation patterns for each utility module, parameter specifications, and return value formats. Document the dateUtils module for match timing calculations, formatters for score and time display, constants for API endpoints and configuration, and haptics for user interaction feedback. Include usage examples, edge case handling, and performance considerations. Address internationalization support, locale-specific formatting, and accessibility considerations in utility implementations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Types and Interfaces
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive types and interfaces documentation for the React Native sports match application. Detail the TypeScript type definitions including match interface with team information and status properties, tournament interface with sport associations and metadata, and API response schemas for data structures. Explain the type safety patterns, interface inheritance, and generic type usage throughout the application. Document the relationship between API responses and TypeScript interfaces, including optional properties, union types, and type guards. Include examples of type usage in components, hooks, and services. Address type inference, type assertion patterns, and error handling for type-related issues. Provide guidelines for extending types when adding new features and maintaining type consistency across the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed performance optimization documentation for the React Native sports match application. Explain the FlatList optimization techniques including removeClippedSubviews, maxToRenderPerBatch, windowSize parameters, and virtualization strategies. Document memoization patterns using React.memo for component optimization and performance monitoring approaches. Detail the countdown timer optimization using requestAnimationFrame for smooth updates without unnecessary re-renders. Include image loading optimizations with expo-image caching, lazy loading strategies, and memory management for large lists. Address rendering performance, bundle size optimization, and runtime performance monitoring. Provide benchmarking methodologies, profiling tools usage, and performance measurement techniques. Include troubleshooting guides for common performance bottlenecks and optimization strategies for different device capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing and Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive testing and deployment documentation for the React Native sports match application. Detail the manual testing checklist including infinite scroll functionality, countdown timer accuracy, filter application, pull-to-refresh behavior, and responsive design validation. Document API testing procedures using curl commands for match list and tournament endpoints. Explain the build process for both Android APK and iOS applications using EAS CLI, including build configuration, platform-specific requirements, and distribution strategies. Include production optimization settings, bundle analysis, and performance profiling for release builds. Address continuous integration setup, automated testing approaches, and deployment pipeline configuration. Provide troubleshooting guides for common build issues, platform-specific problems, and deployment failures.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Technical Assignment - DigiGround React Native Project

## Project Introduction

This is a modern React Native mobile application designed to display and filter sports match schedules. The project follows contemporary mobile development practices with a focus on performance, user experience, and maintainable architecture.

### Purpose Statement
The application provides users with a comprehensive view of upcoming sports matches across various tournaments, featuring advanced filtering capabilities and real-time match status updates.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Deliver a responsive and performant mobile experience for sports match browsing
- Implement sophisticated filtering mechanisms for tournament-based match discovery
- Ensure smooth infinite scrolling and pagination for large datasets
- Provide intuitive user interface with bottom-sheet modals for complex interactions

### Target Audience
Sports enthusiasts who want to track multiple tournaments and filter matches based on their preferences, particularly for cricket, soccer, Australian rules football, basketball, and rugby league.

## Technical Architecture

The application follows a modular React Native architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Root Layout] --> B[Navigation Stack]
    A --> C[Global Providers]
    C --> D[React Query Provider]
    C --> E[Filter Context Provider]
    C --> F[Bottom Sheet Provider]
    B --> G[Main Screen]
    G --> H[Match List Component]
    G --> I[Filter Bottom Sheet]
    H --> J[Match Card Components]
    I --> K[Tournament Selection]
    L[Services Layer] --> M[API Client]
    L --> N[Match API]
    L --> O[Tournament API]
    P[Hooks Layer] --> Q[useMatches Hook]
    P --> R[useTournaments Hook]
    S[Utilities] --> T[Constants & Colors]
    S --> U[Formatters]
    S --> V[Date Utils]
```

### Component Breakdown

**Presentation Layer:**
- **Screens**: Main application screens organized under `/app` directory
- **Components**: Reusable UI components in `/app/components/`
- **Common Components**: Shared components like loading states and empty states

**State Management:**
- **Context API**: Global filter state management
- **React Query**: Server state management and caching
- **Zustand**: Potential state management (though not extensively used)

**Data Layer:**
- **Services**: API communication layer
- **Types**: TypeScript interfaces for type safety
- **Hooks**: Custom React hooks for data fetching

### Design Patterns

1. **Provider Pattern**: Multiple context providers manage different aspects of application state
2. **Hook Pattern**: Custom hooks encapsulate data fetching logic
3. **Component Composition**: Modular component design with clear props interfaces
4. **Factory Pattern**: Bottom sheet components for dynamic modal content

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Root Layout** (`app/_layout.tsx`)
- Configures global providers including React Query, Filter Context, and Bottom Sheet
- Sets up navigation stack with headerless configuration
- Implements gesture handling and safe area management

**Main Screen** (`app/index.tsx`)
- Primary application screen displaying match listings
- Integrates filter functionality and bottom sheet modal
- Manages infinite scroll and loading states

### Core Modules

**Filter Context** (`app/context/FilterContext.tsx`)
- Manages tournament filtering state with pending and active filters
- Provides toggle, select, and clear operations
- Supports filter persistence and application

**Match Management Hook** (`app/hooks/useMatches.ts`)
- Implements infinite query pattern for paginated match data
- Handles loading, error, and pagination states
- Integrates with React Query for caching and background updates

**API Services** (`app/services/`)
- Centralized API client with interceptors for error handling
- Match API for retrieving match data with filtering parameters
- Tournament API for sport and tournament metadata

### Configuration Approach

**Expo Configuration** (`app.json`)
- Multi-platform support (iOS, Android, Web)
- Splash screen configuration with dark mode support
- Navigation setup with typed routes

**Styling Configuration** (`tailwind.config.js`)
- Tailwind CSS integration with NativeWind
- Content scanning for utility classes
- Custom color extensions for consistent theming

### External Dependencies

**Core Framework Dependencies:**
- `expo-router`: Modern navigation system
- `@tanstack/react-query`: Advanced caching and state management
- `@gorhom/bottom-sheet`: Enhanced bottom sheet modals
- `nativewind`: Tailwind CSS for React Native

**Development Dependencies:**
- TypeScript for type safety
- ESLint for code quality
- Prettier for code formatting

### Integration Points

**API Integration** (`app/services/api.ts`)
- Centralized HTTP client with timeout configuration
- Request/response interceptors for error handling
- Environment-based base URL configuration

**UI Integration** (`app/components/`)
- Consistent styling with Tailwind utilities
- Responsive design patterns
- Touch interaction feedback

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[User Interface] --> B[Components]
    B --> C[Hooks]
    C --> D[Services]
    D --> E[API Endpoints]
    F[Context Providers] --> B
    G[React Query] --> C
    H[Bottom Sheet] --> B
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Match Discovery**
- Infinite scroll with automatic pagination
- Real-time match status tracking (upcoming, live, completed)
- Timezone-aware scheduling with configurable offsets

**Advanced Filtering**
- Tournament-based filtering with multi-select capability
- Sport-specific categorization with color coding
- Dynamic filter application with visual indicators

**Performance Optimization**
- Lazy loading for large match lists
- Efficient rendering with FlatList optimization
- Intelligent caching with React Query

### Implementation Highlights

**Infinite Scrolling** (`app/components/match/MatchList.tsx`)
- Optimized FlatList with windowing and batch rendering
- Smart loading indicators and footer management
- Pull-to-refresh with visual feedback

**Filter Modal** (`app/components/filter/FilterSheet.tsx`)
- Bottom sheet with expandable sport categories
- Real-time filter preview and application
- Responsive design with adaptive height

**State Management** (`app/hooks/useMatches.ts`)
- Automatic data fetching with pagination
- Background refetching and cache invalidation
- Error boundary integration with retry mechanisms

### Feature Architecture

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Loading
    Loading --> Loaded: Success
    Loading --> Error: Failure
    Loaded --> Filtering: User Opens Filter
    Filtering --> Applied: User Applies Filters
    Applied --> Loading: New Filter Applied
    Loaded --> InfiniteScroll: User Scrolls
    InfiniteScroll --> LoadingMore: Near End
    LoadingMore --> Loaded: More Data Fetched
    Error --> Loading: Retry
    Applied --> Loaded: Filtered Results
```

The application demonstrates modern React Native development practices with a focus on user experience, performance, and maintainability. The modular architecture allows for easy extension and modification while maintaining code quality and consistency.

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [app/_layout.tsx](app/_layout.tsx)
- [app/index.tsx](app/index.tsx)
- [app/context/FilterContext.tsx](app/context/FilterContext.tsx)
- [app/hooks/useMatches.ts](app/hooks/useMatches.ts)
- [app/services/matchApi.ts](app/services/matchApi.ts)
